ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:0.2_0: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:0.5_0: 51. The training rule on entering monasteries
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.2_0: a number of monks dressed only in a sarong were making robes in a certain village monastery.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.3_0: Nuns entered that monastery without asking permission and approached those monks.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.4_0: But the monks complained and criticized him,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.5_0: “How can nuns enter a monastery without asking permission?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.6_0: “Is it true, monks, that nuns did that?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.10_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.11_0: the Buddha said, “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.12.1_0: ‘If a nun enters a monastery without asking permission, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:1.13_0: In this way the Buddha has laid down a training rule for the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.1_0: Soon afterwards those monks left that monastery.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.2_0: But even though the nuns knew that the monks had left, they did not go there.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.4_0: When the nuns knew that this was the case, they asked permission and then entered that monastery.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.5_0: They approached the monks and bowed down to them.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.6_0: The monks then said to them, “Sisters, why didn’t you sweep the monastery, or put out water for drinking or water for washing?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.7_0: “The Buddha has laid down a training rule that we may not enter a monastery without asking permission.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.8_0: That’s why we didn’t do it.”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.9_0: They told the Buddha. He then had the Sangha gathered and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.10_0: “Monks, when a monk is available, a nun should enter a monastery only after asking permission.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.11_0: the Buddha said, “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.12.1_0: ‘If a nun, when a monk is available, enters a monastery without asking permission, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:2.13_0: In this way the Buddha has laid down a training rule for the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.1_0: Soon afterwards those monks left that monastery once more, before returning once again.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.2_0: Thinking that the monks were still away, the nuns entered the monastery without asking permission.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.4_0: “We have entered a monastery without asking permission, even though a monk was available. And the Buddha has laid down a training rule against this.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.5_0: Could it be that we have committed an offense entailing confession?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.6_0: They told the Buddha what had happened, and he said,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.7_0: Soon afterwards he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.8_0: the Buddha said, “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:3.9.1_0: ‘If a nun, knowing that there are monks in a monastery, enters it without asking permission, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.1.4_0: ... The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.1.6_0: she knows it by herself or others have told her or they have told her.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.1.8_0: even where monks stay at the foot of a tree.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.1.10_0: if she crosses the boundary of an enclosed monastery without asking permission of a monk or a novice monk or a monastery worker, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.1.11_0: If she enters the vicinity of an unenclosed monastery, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.2.1_0: If there are monks in a monastery, and she perceives that there are, and she enters it without asking permission of an available monk, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.2.2_0: If there are monks in a monastery, but she is unsure of it, and she enters it without asking permission of an available monk, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.2.3_0: If there are monks in a monastery, but she does not perceive that there are, and she enters it without asking permission of an available monk, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.2.4_0: If there are no monks in a monastery, but she perceives that there are, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.2.5_0: If there are no monks in a monastery, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.2.6_0: If there are no monks in a monastery, and she does not perceive that there are, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.3.2_0: if she enters after asking permission of an available monk;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.3.3_0: if, when there is no available monk, she enters without asking permission;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.3.4_0: if she goes while looking at the head of a nun in front of her;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.3.5_0: if she is going to where the nuns have gathered;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.3.6_0: if a path goes through the monastery;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.3.8_0: They burn in times of trouble,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.3.10_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc51:4.3.11_0: The first rule, the training rule on fire, is finished.
